table.remarks: Linking table: experiments to the genotypes they produce. There is a one-to-one relationship between an experiment and a genotype since each genotype record should point to one experiment. Add a new experiment_id for each genotype record.

table.name: nd_experiment_phenotype
table.remarks: Linking table: experiments to the phenotypes they produce. There is a one-to-one relationship between an experiment and a phenotype since each phenotype record should point to one experiment. Add a new experiment_id for each phenotype record.

table.name: nd_experiment_protocol
table.remarks: Linking table: experiments to the protocols they involve.

table.name: nd_experiment_pub
table.remarks: Linking nd_experiment(s) to publication(s)

table.name: nd_experiment_stock
table.remarks: Part of a stock or a clone of a stock that is used in an experiment

column.name: stock_id
column.remarks: stock used in the extraction or the corresponding stock for the clone

table.name: nd_experiment_stock_dbxref
table.remarks: Cross-reference experiment_stock to accessions, images, etc

table.name: nd_experiment_stockprop
table.remarks: Property/value associations for experiment_stocks. This table can store the properties such as treatment

column.name: nd_experiment_stock_id
column.remarks: The experiment_stock to which the property applies.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The name of the property as a reference to a controlled vocabulary term.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the property.

column.name: rank
column.remarks: The rank of the property value, if the property has an array of values.

table.name: nd_geolocation
table.remarks: The geo-referencable location of the stock. NOTE: This entity is subject to change as a more general and possibly more OpenGIS-compliant geolocation module may be introduced into Chado.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A textual representation of the location, if this is the original georeference. Optional if the original georeference is available in lat/long coordinates.

column.name: latitude
column.remarks: The decimal latitude coordinate of the georeference, using positive and negative sign to indicate N and S, respectively.

column.name: longitude
column.remarks: The decimal longitude coordinate of the georeference, using positive and negative sign to indicate E and W, respectively.

column.name: geodetic_datum
column.remarks: The geodetic system on which the geo-reference coordinates are based. For geo-references measured between 1984 and 2010, this will typically be WGS84.

column.name: altitude
column.remarks: The altitude (elevation) of the location in meters. If the altitude is only known as a range, this is the average, and altitude_dev will hold half of the width of the range.

table.name: nd_geolocationprop
table.remarks: Property/value associations for geolocations. This table can store the properties such as location and environment

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The name of the property as a reference to a controlled vocabulary term.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the property.

column.name: rank
column.remarks: The rank of the property value, if the property has an array of values.

table.name: nd_protocol
table.remarks: A protocol can be anything that is done as part of the experiment.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The protocol name.

table.name: nd_protocolprop
table.remarks: Property/value associations for protocol.

column.name: nd_protocol_id
column.remarks: The protocol to which the property applies.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The name of the property as a reference to a controlled vocabulary term.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the property.

column.name: rank
column.remarks: The rank of the property value, if the property has an array of values.

table.name: nd_reagent
table.remarks: A reagent such as a primer, an enzyme, an adapter oligo, a linker oligo. Reagents are used in genotyping experiments, or in any other kind of experiment.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name of the reagent. The name should be unique for a given type.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The type of the reagent, for example linker oligomer, or forward primer.

column.name: feature_id
column.remarks: If the reagent is a primer, the feature that it corresponds to. More generally, the corresponding feature for any reagent that has a sequence that maps to another sequence.

table.name: nd_reagent_relationship
table.remarks: Relationships between reagents. Some reagents form a group. i.e., they are used all together or not at all. Examples are adapter/linker/enzyme experiment reagents.

column.name: subject_reagent_id
column.remarks: The subject reagent in the relationship. In parent/child terminology, the subject is the child. For example, in "linkerA 3prime-overhang-linker enzymeA" linkerA is the subject, 3prime-overhand-linker is the type, and enzymeA is the object.

column.name: object_reagent_id
column.remarks: The object reagent in the relationship. In parent/child terminology, the object is the parent. For example, in "linkerA 3prime-overhang-linker enzymeA" linkerA is the subject, 3prime-overhand-linker is the type, and enzymeA is the object.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The type (or predicate) of the relationship. For example, in "linkerA 3prime-overhang-linker enzymeA" linkerA is the subject, 3prime-overhand-linker is the type, and enzymeA is the object.

table.name: organism
table.remarks: The organismal taxonomic classification. Note that phylogenies are represented using the phylogeny module, and taxonomies can be represented using the cvterm module or the phylogeny module

column.name: species
column.remarks: A type of organism is always uniquely identified by genus+species. When mapping from the NCBI taxonomy names.dmp file, the unique-name column must be used where it is present, as the name column is not always unique (eg environmental samples). If a particular strain or subspecies is to be represented, this is appended onto the species name. Follows standard NCBI taxonomy pattern

table.name: organismprop
table.remarks: tag-value properties - follows standard chado model

table.name: phendesc
table.remarks: A summary of a _set_ of phenotypic statements for any one gcontext made in any one publication.

table.name: phenotype_comparison
table.remarks: Comparison of phenotypes e.g., genotype1/environment1/phenotype1 "non-suppressible" with respect to genotype2/environment2/phenotype2.

table.name: phenotypeprop
table.remarks: A phenotype can have any number of slot-value property tags attached to it. This is an alternative to hardcoding a list of columns in the relational schema, and is completely extensible. There is a unique constraint, phenotypeprop_c1, for the combination of phenotype_id, rank, and type_id. Multivalued property-value pairs must be differentiated by rank.

table.name: phenstatement
table.remarks: Phenotypes are things like "larval lethal". Phenstatements are things like "dpp-1 is recessive larval lethal". So essentially phenstatement is a linking table expressing the relationship between genotype, environment, and phenotype.

table.name: phylonode
table.remarks: This is the most pervasive element in the phylogeny module, cataloging the "phylonodes" of tree graphs. Edges are implied by the parent_phylonode_id reflexive closure. For all nodes in a nested set implementation the left and right index will be *between* the parents left and right indexes.

column.name: parent_phylonode_id
column.remarks: Root phylonode can have null parent_phylonode_id value.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: Type: e.g. root, interior, leaf.

column.name: feature_id
column.remarks: Phylonodes can have optional features attached to them e.g. a protein or nucleotide sequence usually attached to a leaf of the phylotree for non-leaf nodes, the feature may be a feature that is an instance of SO:match; this feature is the alignment of all leaf features beneath it.

table.name: phylonode_dbxref
table.remarks: For example, for orthology, paralogy group identifiers; could also be used for NCBI taxonomy; for sequences, refer to phylonode_feature, feature associated dbxrefs.

table.name: phylonode_organism
table.remarks: This linking table should only be used for nodes in taxonomy trees; it provides a mapping between the node and an organism. One node can have zero or one organisms, one organism can have zero or more nodes (although typically it should only have one in the standard NCBI taxonomy tree).

column.name: phylonode_id
column.remarks: One phylonode cannot refer to >1 organism.

table.name: phylonode_relationship
table.remarks: This is for relationships that are not strictly hierarchical; for example, horizontal gene transfer. Most phylogenetic trees are strictly hierarchical, nevertheless it is here for completeness.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: type_id could designate phylonode hierarchy relationships, for example: species taxonomy (kingdom, order, family, genus, species), "ortholog/paralog", "fold/superfold", etc.

table.name: phylotree
table.remarks: Global anchor for phylogenetic tree.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: Type: protein, nucleotide, taxonomy, for example. The type should be any SO type, or "taxonomy".

table.name: phylotree_pub
table.remarks: Tracks citations global to the tree e.g. multiple sequence alignment supporting tree construction.

table.name: plants
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, stock.uniquename AS plant_name FROM stock WHERE ((stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text))) AND (stock.is_obsolete = false)) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, stock.uniquename;

table.name: plantsxplots
table.viewSql: SELECT plant.stock_id AS plant_id, plot.stock_id AS plot_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock plot ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = plot.stock_id) AND (plot.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) JOIN stock_relationship plant_relationship ON ((plot.stock_id = plant_relationship.subject_id))) JOIN stock plant ON (((plant_relationship.object_id = plant.stock_id) AND (plant.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) GROUP BY plant.stock_id, plot.stock_id;

table.name: plantsxseedlots
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id;

table.name: plantsxtrait_components
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id FROM ((((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, trait_component.cvterm_id;

table.name: plantsxtraits
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, materialized_phenoview.trait_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.trait_id;

table.name: plantsxtrial_designs
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id FROM ((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, trialdesign.value;

table.name: plantsxtrial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, trialterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: plantsxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: plantsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plant_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plant'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: plots
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, stock.uniquename AS plot_name FROM stock WHERE ((stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text))) AND (stock.is_obsolete = false)) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, stock.uniquename;

table.name: plotsxseedlots
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id;

table.name: plotsxtrait_components
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id FROM ((((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, trait_component.cvterm_id;

table.name: plotsxtraits
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, materialized_phenoview.trait_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.trait_id;

table.name: plotsxtrial_designs
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id FROM ((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, trialdesign.value;

table.name: plotsxtrial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, trialterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: plotsxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: plotsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS plot_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN stock ON (((materialized_phenoview.stock_id = stock.stock_id) AND (stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'plot'::text)))))) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: An optional cvterm_id that specifies what type of project this record is. Prior to 1.4, project type was set with an projectprop.

table.name: project_contact
table.remarks: Linking project(s) to contact(s)

table.name: project_pub
table.remarks: Linking project(s) to publication(s)

table.name: project_relationship
table.remarks: A project can be composed of several smaller scale projects

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The type of relationship being stated, such as "is part of".

table.name: pub
table.remarks: A documented provenance artefact - publications, documents, personal communication

column.name: title
column.remarks: descriptive general heading

column.name: volumetitle
column.remarks: title of part if one of a series

column.name: series_name
column.remarks: full name of (journal) series

column.name: pages
column.remarks: page number range[s], eg, 457--459, viii + 664pp, lv--lvii

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: the type of the publication (book, journal, poem, graffiti, etc). Uses pub cv

table.name: pub_dbxref
table.remarks: Handle links to eg, pubmed, biosis, zoorec, OCLC, mdeline, ISSN, coden...

table.name: pub_relationship
table.remarks: Handle relationships between publications, eg, when one publication makes others obsolete, when one publication contains errata with respect to other publication(s), or when one publication also appears in another pub (I think these three are it - at least for fb)

table.name: pubauthor
table.remarks: an author for a publication. Note the denormalisation (hence lack of _ in table name) - this is deliberate as it is in general too hard to assign IDs to authors.

column.name: rank
column.remarks: order of author in author list for this pub - order is important

column.name: editor
column.remarks: indicates whether the author is an editor for linked publication. Note: this is a boolean field but does not follow the normal chado convention for naming booleans

column.name: givennames
column.remarks: first name, initials

column.name: suffix
column.remarks: Jr., Sr., etc

table.name: pubprop
table.remarks: Property-value pairs for a pub. Follows standard chado pattern - see sequence module for details

table.name: resource_file
table.remarks: each row defines a composite dataset, downloadable at the url cxgn-resource://name, that is composed of other downloadable datasets, according to the expression column. See CXGN::Tools::Wget for the accompanying code

table.name: seedlots
table.viewSql: SELECT stock.stock_id AS seedlot_id, stock.uniquename AS seedlot_name FROM stock WHERE ((stock.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'seedlot'::text))) AND (stock.is_obsolete = false)) GROUP BY stock.stock_id, stock.uniquename;

table.name: seedlotsxtrait_components
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, trait_component.cvterm_id;

table.name: seedlotsxtraits
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, materialized_phenoview.trait_id FROM materialized_phenoview GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, materialized_phenoview.trait_id;

table.name: seedlotsxtrial_designs
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, trialdesign.value;

table.name: seedlotsxtrial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id FROM ((materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, trialterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: seedlotsxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM materialized_phenoview GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: seedlotsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM materialized_phenoview GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.seedlot_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: stock
table.remarks: Any stock can be globally identified by the combination of organism, uniquename and stock type. A stock is the physical entities, either living or preserved, held by collections. Stocks belong to a collection; they have IDs, type, organism, description and may have a genotype.

column.name: dbxref_id
column.remarks: The dbxref_id is an optional primary stable identifier for this stock. Secondary indentifiers and external dbxrefs go in table: stock_dbxref.

column.name: organism_id
column.remarks: The organism_id is the organism to which the stock belongs. This column should only be left blank if the organism cannot be determined.

column.name: name
column.remarks: The name is a human-readable local name for a stock.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description is the genetic description provided in the stock list.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The type_id foreign key links to a controlled vocabulary of stock types. The would include living stock, genomic DNA, preserved specimen. Secondary cvterms for stocks would go in stock_cvterm.

table.name: stock_cvterm
table.remarks: stock_cvterm links a stock to cvterms. This is for secondary cvterms; primary cvterms should use stock.type_id.

table.name: stock_cvtermprop
table.remarks: Extensible properties for stock to cvterm associations. Examples: GO evidence codes; qualifiers; metadata such as the date on which the entry was curated and the source of the association. See the stockprop table for meanings of type_id, value and rank.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The name of the property/slot is a cvterm. The meaning of the property is defined in that cvterm. cvterms may come from the OBO evidence code cv.

column.name: value
column.remarks: The value of the property, represented as text. Numeric values are converted to their text representation. This is less efficient than using native database types, but is easier to query.

column.name: rank
column.remarks: Property-Value ordering. Any stock_cvterm can have multiple values for any particular property type - these are ordered in a list using rank, counting from zero. For properties that are single-valued rather than multi-valued, the default 0 value should be used.

table.name: stock_dbxref
table.remarks: stock_dbxref links a stock to dbxrefs. This is for secondary identifiers; primary identifiers should use stock.dbxref_id.

column.name: is_current
column.remarks: The is_current boolean indicates whether the linked dbxref is the current -official- dbxref for the linked stock.

table.name: stock_dbxrefprop
table.remarks: A stock_dbxref can have any number of slot-value property tags attached to it. This is useful for storing properties related to dbxref annotations of stocks, such as evidence codes, and references, and metadata, such as create/modify dates. This is an alternative to hardcoding a list of columns in the relational schema, and is completely extensible. There is a unique constraint, stock_dbxrefprop_c1, for the combination of stock_dbxref_id, rank, and type_id. Multivalued property-value pairs must be differentiated by rank.

table.name: stock_genotype
table.remarks: Simple table linking a stock to a genotype. Features with genotypes can be linked to stocks thru feature_genotype -> genotype -> stock_genotype -> stock.

table.name: stock_pub
table.remarks: Provenance. Linking table between stocks and, for example, a stocklist computer file.

column.name: subject_id
column.remarks: stock_relationship.subject_id is the subject of the subj-predicate-obj sentence. This is typically the substock.

column.name: object_id
column.remarks: stock_relationship.object_id is the object of the subj-predicate-obj sentence. This is typically the container stock.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: stock_relationship.type_id is relationship type between subject and object. This is a cvterm, typically from the OBO relationship ontology, although other relationship types are allowed.

column.name: value
column.remarks: stock_relationship.value is for additional notes or comments.

column.name: rank
column.remarks: stock_relationship.rank is the ordering of subject stocks with respect to the object stock may be important where rank is used to order these; starts from zero.

table.name: stock_relationship_cvterm
table.remarks: For germplasm maintenance and pedigree data, stock_relationship. type_id will record cvterms such as "is a female parent of", "a parent for mutation", "is a group_id of", "is a source_id of", etc The cvterms for higher categories such as "generative", "derivative" or "maintenance" can be stored in table stock_relationship_cvterm

table.name: stock_relationship_pub
table.remarks: Provenance. Attach optional evidence to a stock_relationship in the form of a publication.

table.name: stockcollection
table.remarks: The lab or stock center distributing the stocks in their collection.

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: type_id is the collection type cv.

column.name: contact_id
column.remarks: contact_id links to the contact information for the collection.

column.name: name
column.remarks: name is the collection.

column.name: uniquename
column.remarks: uniqename is the value of the collection cv.

table.name: stockcollection_stock
table.remarks: stockcollection_stock links a stock collection to the stocks which are contained in the collection.

table.name: stockcollectionprop

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: The cv for the type_id is "stockcollection property type".

table.name: stockprop
table.remarks: A stock can have any number of slot-value property tags attached to it. This is an alternative to hardcoding a list of columns in the relational schema, and is completely extensible. There is a unique constraint, stockprop_c1, for the combination of stock_id, rank, and type_id. Multivalued property-value pairs must be differentiated by rank.

table.name: stockprop_pub
table.remarks: Provenance. Any stockprop assignment can optionally be supported by a publication.

table.name: synonym
table.remarks: A synonym for a feature. One feature can have multiple synonyms, and the same synonym can apply to multiple features

column.name: name
column.remarks: The synonym itself. Should be human-readable machine-searchable ascii text

column.name: type_id
column.remarks: types would be symbol and fullname for now

column.name: synonym_sgml
column.remarks: The fully specified synonym, with any non-ascii characters encoded in SGML

table.name: trait_components
table.viewSql: SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id, (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text) AS trait_component_name FROM ((((((cv JOIN cvprop ON (((cv.cv_id = cvprop.cv_id) AND (cvprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm_1.cvterm_id FROM cvterm cvterm_1 WHERE ((cvterm_1.name)::text = ANY ('{object_ontology,attribute_ontology,method_ontology,unit_ontology,time_ontology}'::text[]))))))) JOIN cvterm ON ((cvprop.cv_id = cvterm.cv_id))) JOIN dbxref USING (dbxref_id)) JOIN db ON ((dbxref.db_id = db.db_id))) LEFT JOIN cvterm_relationship is_subject ON ((cvterm.cvterm_id = is_subject.subject_id))) LEFT JOIN cvterm_relationship is_object ON ((cvterm.cvterm_id = is_object.object_id))) WHERE ((is_object.object_id IS NULL) AND (is_subject.subject_id IS NOT NULL)) GROUP BY (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text), cvterm.cvterm_id ORDER BY (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text), cvterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: trait_componentsxtrial_designs
table.viewSql: SELECT trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id, trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id FROM ((((materialized_phenoview JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY trait_component.cvterm_id, trialdesign.value;

table.name: trait_componentsxtrial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id, trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id FROM (((((materialized_phenoview JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY trait_component.cvterm_id, trialterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: trait_componentsxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY trait_component.cvterm_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: trait_componentsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT trait_component.cvterm_id AS trait_component_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN cvterm trait ON ((materialized_phenoview.trait_id = trait.cvterm_id))) JOIN cvterm_relationship ON (((trait.cvterm_id = cvterm_relationship.object_id) AND (cvterm_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'contains'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trait_component ON ((cvterm_relationship.subject_id = trait_component.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY trait_component.cvterm_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: traits
table.viewSql: SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id AS trait_id, (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text) AS trait_name FROM (((((cv JOIN cvprop ON (((cv.cv_id = cvprop.cv_id) AND (cvprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm_1.cvterm_id FROM cvterm cvterm_1 WHERE ((cvterm_1.name)::text = 'trait_ontology'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm ON ((cvprop.cv_id = cvterm.cv_id))) JOIN dbxref USING (dbxref_id)) JOIN db ON ((dbxref.db_id = db.db_id))) LEFT JOIN cvterm_relationship is_variable ON (((cvterm.cvterm_id = is_variable.subject_id) AND (is_variable.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm_1.cvterm_id FROM cvterm cvterm_1 WHERE ((cvterm_1.name)::text = 'VARIABLE_OF'::text)))))) WHERE (is_variable.subject_id IS NOT NULL) GROUP BY cvterm.cvterm_id, (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text) UNION SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id AS trait_id, (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text) AS trait_name FROM (((((cv JOIN cvprop ON (((cv.cv_id = cvprop.cv_id) AND (cvprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm_1.cvterm_id FROM cvterm cvterm_1 WHERE ((cvterm_1.name)::text = 'composed_trait_ontology'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm ON ((cvprop.cv_id = cvterm.cv_id))) JOIN dbxref USING (dbxref_id)) JOIN db ON ((dbxref.db_id = db.db_id))) LEFT JOIN cvterm_relationship is_subject ON ((cvterm.cvterm_id = is_subject.subject_id))) WHERE (is_subject.subject_id IS NOT NULL) GROUP BY cvterm.cvterm_id, (((((cvterm.name)::text || '|'::text) || (db.name)::text) || ':'::text) || (dbxref.accession)::text) ORDER BY 2;

table.name: traitsxtrial_designs
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.trait_id, trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.trait_id, trialdesign.value;

table.name: traitsxtrial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.trait_id, trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id FROM ((materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.trait_id, trialterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: traitsxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.trait_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM materialized_phenoview GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.trait_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: traitsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.trait_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM materialized_phenoview GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.trait_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: trial_designs
table.viewSql: SELECT projectprop.value AS trial_design_id, projectprop.value AS trial_design_name FROM (projectprop JOIN cvterm ON ((projectprop.type_id = cvterm.cvterm_id))) WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text) GROUP BY projectprop.value;

table.name: trial_designsxtrial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id, trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id FROM (((materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY trialdesign.value, trialterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: trial_designsxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY trialdesign.value, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: trial_designsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT trialdesign.value AS trial_design_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM (materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialdesign ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialdesign.project_id) AND (trialdesign.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'design'::text)))))) GROUP BY trialdesign.value, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: trial_types
table.viewSql: SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id, cvterm.name AS trial_type_name FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text) GROUP BY cvterm.cvterm_id;

table.name: trial_typesxtrials
table.viewSql: SELECT trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id FROM ((materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY trialterm.cvterm_id, materialized_phenoview.trial_id;

table.name: trial_typesxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT trialterm.cvterm_id AS trial_type_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM ((materialized_phenoview JOIN projectprop trialprop ON (((materialized_phenoview.trial_id = trialprop.project_id) AND (trialprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM (cvterm JOIN cv USING (cv_id)) WHERE ((cv.name)::text = 'project_type'::text)))))) JOIN cvterm trialterm ON ((trialprop.type_id = trialterm.cvterm_id))) GROUP BY trialterm.cvterm_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: trials
table.viewSql: SELECT trial.project_id AS trial_id, trial.name AS trial_name FROM (((project breeding_program JOIN project_relationship ON (((breeding_program.project_id = project_relationship.object_project_id) AND (project_relationship.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'breeding_program_trial_relationship'::text)))))) JOIN project trial ON ((project_relationship.subject_project_id = trial.project_id))) JOIN projectprop ON ((trial.project_id = projectprop.project_id))) WHERE (NOT (projectprop.type_id IN ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE (((cvterm.name)::text = 'cross'::text) OR ((cvterm.name)::text = 'trial_folder'::text) OR ((cvterm.name)::text = 'folder_for_trials'::text) OR ((cvterm.name)::text = 'folder_for_crosses'::text) OR ((cvterm.name)::text = 'folder_for_genotyping_trials'::text))))) GROUP BY trial.project_id, trial.name;

table.name: trialsxyears
table.viewSql: SELECT materialized_phenoview.trial_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id FROM materialized_phenoview GROUP BY materialized_phenoview.trial_id, materialized_phenoview.year_id;

table.name: years
table.viewSql: SELECT projectprop.value AS year_id, projectprop.value AS year_name FROM projectprop WHERE (projectprop.type_id = ( SELECT cvterm.cvterm_id FROM cvterm WHERE ((cvterm.name)::text = 'project year'::text))) GROUP BY projectprop.value;

feature_disjoint_from(integer)
routine.definition: SELECT feature.* FROM feature INNER JOIN featureloc AS x ON (x.feature_id=feature.feature_id) INNER JOIN featureloc AS y ON (y.feature_id=$1) WHERE x.srcfeature_id = y.srcfeature_id AND ( x.fmax < y.fmin OR x.fmin > y.fmax )

routine.name: feature_overlaps(integer)
routine.definition: SELECT feature.* FROM feature INNER JOIN featureloc AS x ON (x.feature_id=feature.feature_id) INNER JOIN featureloc AS y ON (y.feature_id=$1) WHERE x.srcfeature_id = y.srcfeature_id AND ( x.fmax >= y.fmin AND x.fmin <= y.fmax )

routine.name: featureloc_slice(character varying, integer, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT featureloc.* FROM featureloc INNER JOIN feature AS srcf ON (srcf.feature_id = featureloc.srcfeature_id) WHERE boxquery($2, $3) @ boxrange(fmin,fmax) AND srcf.name = $1

routine.name: featureloc_slice(integer, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT * from featureloc where boxquery($1, $2) @ boxrange(fmin,fmax)

routine.name: featureloc_slice(integer, integer, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT * FROM featureloc WHERE boxquery($2, $3) @ boxrange(fmin,fmax) AND srcfeature_id = $1

routine.name: featureslice(integer, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT * from featureloc where boxquery($1, $2) @ boxrange(fmin,fmax)

routine.name: gffattstring(integer)
gfffeatureatts(integer)
routine.definition: SELECT feature_id, 'cvterm' AS type, s.name AS attribute FROM cvterm s, feature_cvterm fs WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.cvterm_id = s.cvterm_id UNION SELECT feature_id, 'dbxref' AS type, d.name || ':' || s.accession AS attribute FROM dbxref s, feature_dbxref fs, db d WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.dbxref_id = s.dbxref_id AND s.db_id = d.db_id --UNION --SELECT feature_id, 'expression' AS type, s.description AS attribute --FROM expression s, feature_expression fs --WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.expression_id = s.expression_id --UNION --SELECT fg.feature_id, 'genotype' AS type, g.uniquename||': '||g.description AS attribute --FROM gcontext g, feature_gcontext fg --WHERE fg.feature_id= $1 AND g.gcontext_id = fg.gcontext_id --UNION --SELECT feature_id, 'genotype' AS type, s.description AS attribute --FROM genotype s, feature_genotype fs --WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.genotype_id = s.genotype_id --UNION --SELECT feature_id, 'phenotype' AS type, s.description AS attribute --FROM phenotype s, feature_phenotype fs --WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.phenotype_id = s.phenotype_id UNION SELECT feature_id, 'synonym' AS type, s.name AS attribute FROM synonym s, feature_synonym fs WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.synonym_id = s.synonym_id UNION SELECT fp.feature_id,cv.name,fp.value FROM featureprop fp, cvterm cv WHERE fp.feature_id= $1 AND fp.type_id = cv.cvterm_id UNION SELECT feature_id, 'pub' AS type, s.series_name || ':' || s.title AS attribute FROM pub s, feature_pub fs WHERE fs.feature_id= $1 AND fs.pub_id = s.pub_id

randstring(length integer)
routine.definition: declare ret varchar; begin ret = ''; for i in 1..length loop ret = ret || substring ('abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz1234567890ABCDEFGHIJKLMN' from cast (random()*50 as integer) for 1); end loop; return ret; end
